SENT.plain: PURPOSE: Thalidomide is an effective treatment for recurrent aphthosis but its effectiveness at low dose has been rarely assessed
METHODS: Single-centre non-randomized retrospective open study
RESULTS: Forty-seven patients were treated with thalidomide for recurrent aphthosis (41 patients) or BehÃ§et disease (six patients)
Remission was obtained with a dose of 25 mg daily
Discontinuation of treatment for side effects was not observed in this case series
CONCLUSION: Low dose thalidomide below 50 mg daily is an effective and well tolerated treatment of aphthosis
